title: Relates to the protection of victims of domestic violence act
summary: Relates to the protection of victims of domestic violence act, which requires defendants to wear global positioning systems monitoring the location of the defendant.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          613

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. PEOPLES-STOKES, CASTRO, GALEF, TITUS, MAYERSOHN
         -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. BOYLAND, BURLING,  CALHOUN,  CORWIN,
         CROUCH,  DESTITO,  GIBSON,  GLICK  --  read  once  and referred to the
         Committee on Governmental Operations

       AN ACT to amend the executive  law,  in  relation  to  establishing  the
         "protection of victims of domestic violence act"

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The executive law is amended by adding a new  article  22-A
    2  to read as follows:
    3                                ARTICLE 22-A
    4                 PROTECTION OF VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE
    5  SECTION 636. SHORT TITLE.
    6          637. CONDITIONS  FOR  RELEASING  DEFENDANTS TO PROTECTIVE CONDI-
    7                        TIONS.
    8    S 636. SHORT TITLE. THIS ACT SHALL BE KNOWN AND MAY BE  CITED  AS  THE
    9  "PROTECTION OF VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE ACT".
   10    S  637.  CONDITIONS FOR RELEASING DEFENDANTS TO PROTECTIVE CONDITIONS.
   11  1.  A JUDGE MAY RELEASE UNDER THIS SECTION A DEFENDANT SUBJECT TO CONDI-
   12  TIONS REASONABLY NECESSARY FOR THE  PROTECTION  OF  ONE  OR  MORE  NAMED
   13  PERSONS.  IF  A JUDGE RELEASES UNDER THIS SECTION A DEFENDANT SUBJECT TO
   14  PROTECTIVE CONDITIONS, THE JUDGE SHALL MAKE A FINDING OF  THE  NEED  FOR
   15  PROTECTIVE  CONDITIONS  AND  INFORM  THE DEFENDANT ON THE RECORD, EITHER
   16  ORALLY OR BY A WRITING THAT IS PERSONALLY DELIVERED TO THE DEFENDANT, OF
   17  THE SPECIFIC CONDITIONS IMPOSED AND THAT IF  THE  DEFENDANT  VIOLATES  A
   18  CONDITION  OF  RELEASE,  HE  OR  SHE WILL BE SUBJECT TO ARREST WITHOUT A
   19  WARRANT AND MAY HAVE HIS OR HER BAIL FORFEITED OR REVOKED AND NEW CONDI-
   20  TIONS OF RELEASE IMPOSED, IN ADDITION TO ANY OTHER PENALTIES THAT MAY BE
   21  IMPOSED IF THE DEFENDANT IS FOUND IN CONTEMPT OF COURT.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01321-01-1

       A. 613                              2

    1    2. AN ORDER OR AMENDED ORDER ISSUED  UNDER  SUBDIVISION  ONE  OF  THIS
    2  SECTION SHALL CONTAIN ALL OF THE FOLLOWING:
    3    (A) A STATEMENT OF THE DEFENDANT'S FULL NAME.
    4    (B)  A STATEMENT OF THE DEFENDANT'S HEIGHT, WEIGHT, RACE, SEX, DATE OF
    5  BIRTH, HAIR COLOR, EYE COLOR, AND ANY OTHER IDENTIFYING INFORMATION  THE
    6  JUDGE CONSIDERS APPROPRIATE.
    7    (C) A STATEMENT OF THE DATE THE CONDITIONS BECOME EFFECTIVE.
    8    (D) A STATEMENT OF THE DATE ON WHICH THE ORDER WILL EXPIRE.
    9    (E) A STATEMENT OF THE CONDITIONS IMPOSED.
   10    3.  AN ORDER OR AMENDED ORDER ISSUED UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION AND SUBDI-
   11  VISION ONE OF THIS SECTION MAY IMPOSE A CONDITION THAT THE DEFENDANT NOT
   12  PURCHASE OR POSSESS A FIREARM. HOWEVER, IF THE COURT ORDERS THE  DEFEND-
   13  ANT  TO  CARRY OR WEAR A GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM DEVICE AS A CONDITION
   14  OF RELEASE AS DESCRIBED IN SUBDIVISION SIX OF THIS  SECTION,  THE  COURT
   15  SHALL ALSO IMPOSE A CONDITION THAT THE DEFENDANT NOT PURCHASE OR POSSESS
   16  A FIREARM.
   17    4.  THE JUDGE SHALL IMMEDIATELY DIRECT A LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY WITHIN
   18  THE JURISDICTION OF THE COURT, IN WRITING, TO ENTER AN ORDER OR  AMENDED
   19  ORDER  ISSUED  UNDER SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION OR SUBDIVISIONS ONE
   20  AND THREE OF THIS SECTION INTO THE COMPUTER SYSTEM TO CARRY  INFORMATION
   21  OF  ORDERS  OF  PROTECTION AND WARRANTS OF ARREST AS PROVIDED BY SECTION
   22  TWO HUNDRED TWENTY-ONE-A OF THIS CHAPTER. IF THE ORDER OR AMENDED  ORDER
   23  IS  RESCINDED,  THE  JUDGE  SHALL  IMMEDIATELY ORDER THE LAW ENFORCEMENT
   24  AGENCY TO REMOVE THE ORDER OR AMENDED ORDER FROM THE COMPUTER SYSTEM  TO
   25  CARRY INFORMATION OF ORDERS OF PROTECTION AND WARRANTS OF ARREST.
   26    5. A LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY WITHIN THE JURISDICTION OF THE COURT SHALL
   27  IMMEDIATELY  ENTER AN ORDER OR AMENDED ORDER INTO THE COMPUTER SYSTEM TO
   28  CARRY INFORMATION OF ORDERS OF PROTECTION  AND  WARRANTS  OF  ARREST  AS
   29  PROVIDED  BY  SECTION TWO HUNDRED TWENTY-ONE-A OF THIS CHAPTER, OR SHALL
   30  REMOVE THE ORDER OR AMENDED ORDER FROM  THE  COMPUTER  SYSTEM  TO  CARRY
   31  INFORMATION  OF ORDERS OF PROTECTION AND WARRANTS OF ARREST UPON EXPIRA-
   32  TION OF THE ORDER OR AS DIRECTED BY THE COURT UNDER SUBDIVISION FOUR  OF
   33  THIS SECTION.
   34    6.  IF  A  DEFENDANT  WHO  IS  CHARGED WITH A CRIME INVOLVING DOMESTIC
   35  VIOLENCE IS RELEASED UNDER THIS SECTION, THE JUDGE MAY ORDER THE DEFEND-
   36  ANT TO CARRY OR WEAR A GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM DEVICE AS  A  CONDITION
   37  OF  RELEASE. WITH THE INFORMED CONSENT OF THE VICTIM, THE COURT MAY ALSO
   38  ORDER THE DEFENDANT TO PROVIDE THE VICTIM OF THE CHARGED CRIME  WITH  AN
   39  ELECTRONIC  RECEPTOR  DEVICE CAPABLE OF RECEIVING THE GLOBAL POSITIONING
   40  SYSTEM INFORMATION FROM THE DEVICE CARRIED OR WORN BY THE DEFENDANT THAT
   41  NOTIFIES THE VICTIM IF THE DEFENDANT IS LOCATED WITHIN  A  PROXIMITY  TO
   42  THE  VICTIM  AS DETERMINED BY THE JUDGE IN CONSULTATION WITH THE VICTIM.
   43  THE VICTIM SHALL ALSO BE FURNISHED WITH A  TELEPHONE  CONTACT  WITH  THE
   44  LOCAL  LAW  ENFORCEMENT  AGENCY  TO  REQUEST IMMEDIATE ASSISTANCE IF THE
   45  DEFENDANT IS LOCATED WITHIN THAT PROXIMITY TO THE VICTIM.  IN  ADDITION,
   46  THE  VICTIM  MAY PROVIDE THE COURT WITH A LIST OF AREAS FROM WHICH HE OR
   47  SHE WOULD LIKE THE DEFENDANT EXCLUDED.  THE  COURT  SHALL  CONSIDER  THE
   48  VICTIM'S  REQUEST AND SHALL DETERMINE WHICH AREAS THE DEFENDANT SHALL BE
   49  PROHIBITED FROM ACCESSING. THE COURT SHALL INSTRUCT THE GLOBAL POSITION-
   50  ING SYSTEM TO NOTIFY THE PROPER AUTHORITIES IF  THE  DEFENDANT  VIOLATES
   51  THE ORDER. IN DETERMINING WHETHER TO ORDER A DEFENDANT TO PARTICIPATE IN
   52  GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM MONITORING, THE COURT SHALL CONSIDER THE LIKE-
   53  LIHOOD  THAT  THE DEFENDANT'S PARTICIPATION IN GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM
   54  MONITORING WILL DETER THE DEFENDANT FROM  SEEKING  TO  KILL,  PHYSICALLY
   55  INJURE,  STALK,  OR  OTHERWISE  THREATEN  THE VICTIM PRIOR TO TRIAL. THE
   56  VICTIM MAY REQUEST THE COURT TO TERMINATE THE VICTIM'S PARTICIPATION  IN

       A. 613                              3

    1  GLOBAL  POSITIONING  SYSTEM MONITORING OF THE DEFENDANT AT ANY TIME. THE
    2  COURT SHALL NOT IMPOSE SANCTIONS ON THE VICTIM FOR REFUSING  TO  PARTIC-
    3  IPATE  IN  GLOBAL  POSITIONING  SYSTEM  MONITORING UNDER THIS SECTION. A
    4  DEFENDANT  DESCRIBED  IN  THIS SECTION SHALL ONLY BE RELEASED UNDER THIS
    5  SECTION IF HE OR SHE AGREES TO PAY THE COST OF THE DEVICE AND ANY  MONI-
    6  TORING  OF  THE DEVICE AS A CONDITION OF RELEASE OR TO PERFORM COMMUNITY
    7  SERVICE WORK IN LIEU OF PAYING THAT COST. AS USED IN THIS SECTION:
    8    (A) "DOMESTIC VIOLENCE" MEANS AN ACT WHICH WOULD CONSTITUTE  A  FAMILY
    9  OFFENSE  PURSUANT  TO SUBDIVISION ONE OF SECTION EIGHT HUNDRED TWELVE OF
   10  THE FAMILY COURT ACT.
   11    (B) "GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM" MEANS  A  SYSTEM  THAT  ELECTRONICALLY
   12  DETERMINES  AND  REPORTS  THE  LOCATION  OF AN INDIVIDUAL BY MEANS OF AN
   13  ANKLE BRACELET TRANSMITTER OR SIMILAR DEVICE WORN BY THE INDIVIDUAL THAT
   14  TRANSMITS LATITUDE AND LONGITUDE DATA TO MONITORING AUTHORITIES  THROUGH
   15  GLOBAL  POSITIONING SATELLITE TECHNOLOGY BUT DOES NOT CONTAIN OR OPERATE
   16  ANY GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM TECHNOLOGY OR RADIO FREQUENCY  IDENTIFICA-
   17  TION  TECHNOLOGY OR SIMILAR TECHNOLOGY THAT IS IMPLANTED IN OR OTHERWISE
   18  INVADES OR VIOLATES THE CORPOREAL BODY OF THE INDIVIDUAL.
   19    (C) "INFORMED CONSENT" MEANS THAT THE  VICTIM  WAS  GIVEN  INFORMATION
   20  CONCERNING  ALL  OF  THE  FOLLOWING  BEFORE CONSENTING TO PARTICIPATE IN
   21  GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM MONITORING:
   22    (1) THE VICTIM'S RIGHT TO REFUSE TO PARTICIPATE IN GLOBAL  POSITIONING
   23  SYSTEM  MONITORING AND THE PROCESS FOR REQUESTING THE COURT TO TERMINATE
   24  THE VICTIM'S PARTICIPATION AFTER IT HAS BEEN ORDERED.
   25    (2) THE MANNER IN WHICH THE GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM MONITORING TECH-
   26  NOLOGY FUNCTIONS AND THE RISKS AND LIMITATIONS OF THAT  TECHNOLOGY,  AND
   27  THE  EXTENT  TO  WHICH  THE  SYSTEM  WILL  TRACK AND RECORD THE VICTIM'S
   28  LOCATION AND MOVEMENTS.
   29    (3) THE BOUNDARIES IMPOSED ON THE DEFENDANT DURING  THE  GLOBAL  POSI-
   30  TIONING SYSTEM MONITORING.
   31    (4) SANCTIONS THAT THE COURT MAY IMPOSE ON THE DEFENDANT FOR VIOLATING
   32  AN ORDER ISSUED UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION.
   33    (5)  THE  PROCEDURE  THAT  THE  VICTIM  IS  TO FOLLOW IF THE DEFENDANT
   34  VIOLATES AN ORDER ISSUED UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION OR IF GLOBAL POSITIONING
   35  SYSTEM EQUIPMENT FAILS.
   36    (6) IDENTIFICATION OF SUPPORT SERVICES AVAILABLE TO ASSIST THE  VICTIM
   37  TO  DEVELOP  A SAFETY PLAN TO USE IF THE COURT'S ORDER ISSUED UNDER THIS
   38  SUBDIVISION IS VIOLATED OR IF GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM EQUIPMENT FAILS.
   39    (7) IDENTIFICATION OF  COMMUNITY  SERVICES  AVAILABLE  TO  ASSIST  THE
   40  VICTIM  IN  OBTAINING  SHELTER, COUNSELING, EDUCATION, CHILD CARE, LEGAL
   41  REPRESENTATION, AND  OTHER  HELP  IN  ADDRESSING  THE  CONSEQUENCES  AND
   42  EFFECTS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE.
   43    (8) THE NONCONFIDENTIAL NATURE OF THE VICTIM'S COMMUNICATIONS WITH THE
   44  COURT   CONCERNING   GLOBAL   POSITIONING   SYSTEM  MONITORING  AND  THE
   45  RESTRICTIONS TO BE IMPOSED UPON THE DEFENDANT'S MOVEMENTS.
   46    7. THIS SECTION DOES NOT LIMIT  THE  AUTHORITY  OF  JUDGES  TO  IMPOSE
   47  PROTECTIVE  OR  OTHER RELEASE CONDITIONS UNDER OTHER APPLICABLE STATUTES
   48  OR COURT RULES.
   49    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   50  it shall have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to establishing the "protection of victims of domestic violence act"
